etymology.description: 羊(羊) (yáng, "sheep") + 肚(肚) (dù, "stomach") + 菌(菌) (jùn, "fungus; mushroom")
etymology.interpretation: The word 羊肚菌 (yángdùjùn) literally translates to 'sheep-stomach fungus'. This name is due to the appearance of the morel mushroom, which has a texture and pattern reminiscent of a sheep's stomach lining. This similarity in appearance is a typical way in Chinese to describe objects through familiar imagery.

examples.chinese: 今晚的汤里有羊肚菌(今晚的湯裡有羊肚菌)。
examples.pinyin: Jīn wǎn de tāng lǐ yǒu yángdùjùn.
examples.english: There are morel mushrooms in tonight's soup.

examples.chinese: 农家小院里发现了鲜嫩的羊肚菌(農家小院裡發現了鮮嫩的羊肚菌)，山路边隐约飘来诱人的香气(山路邊隱約飄來誘人的香氣)。
examples.pinyin: Nóngjiā xiǎoyuàn lǐ fāxiàn le xiānnèn de yángdùjùn, shānlù biān yǐnyuē piāolái yòurén de xiāngqì.
examples.english: In a rural courtyard, tender morel mushrooms were discovered, and along the mountain path, an enticing aroma floated.

examples.chinese: 在森林深处(在森林深處)，偶遇一群采摘羊肚菌的农人(偶遇一群採摘羊肚菌的農人)。
examples.pinyin: Zài sēnlín shēnchù, ǒuyù yī qún cǎizhāi yángdùjùn de nóngrén.
examples.english: Deep in the forest, I accidentally met a group of farmers picking morel mushrooms.
